concise_definition: adj. 让步的, 承认的 (concede 的现在分词形式，常作形容词或分词使用)

definitions.explanation_en: Describing an attitude or action in which someone acknowledges the validity of an argument, claim, or point made by another, often reluctantly or under pressure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容某人出于勉强或压力，承认对方论点、主张或观点的合理性。
definitions.example_en: His conceding tone suggested he had lost the debate, even if he didn't say it outright.
definitions.example_cn: 他让步的语气表明他已输掉辩论，尽管他并未明言。

definitions.explanation_en: To admit or acknowledge something as true, valid, or real, especially when it is unfavorable or contrary to one's position.
definitions.explanation_cn: 承认某事为真、有效或真实，尤其当该事与自身立场相悖或对自己不利时。
definitions.example_en: She was conceding ground to her opponent with every point she admitted.
definitions.example_cn: 她每承认一点，就在让步中向对手让出阵地。

definitions.explanation_en: To yield or surrender something, such as a position, right, or advantage, often in a competition or negotiation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在竞争或谈判中让出、放弃某物，如立场、权利或优势。
definitions.example_en: The team was conceding possession to their rivals in the second half.
definitions.example_cn: 下半场，这支队伍在控球权上向对手做出了让步。

comparison.analysis: “Admitting” (承认) 更中性，常用于承认错误、事实或责任，不一定带有被迫或让步的意味。而 “conceding” 隐含了对抗或竞争背景，通常是在不愿的情况下被迫承认对方的合理性，带有更强的妥协色彩。
“Yielding” (让步) 更强调物理或权力上的退让，如让路、让出控制权，常用于行为层面。而 “conceding” 更侧重于认知或论证层面的承认，如承认观点正确，虽常伴随让步，但核心是认知上的认可。
“Acknowledging” (确认/认可) 是一种更中立、更正式的承认行为，不隐含被迫或损失。它可以是礼貌性地承认对方存在或观点，无需放弃自身立场。而 “conceding” 通常意味着在争论中退让，可能削弱自身立场。
